intro: Oriba sylvestris, commonly known as the wild oriba, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. Oriba sylvestris is often found in woodland and forested areas, thriving in humid conditions.
